definition: (TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
see 脈脈|脉脉[mo4 mo4]
to examine or treat medically

sentences.english: Palpation consists of two parts: feeling the pulse and taking the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 切脈包括脈診和切脈兩個部隊份。

sentences.english: Pulse-taking is a miraculous and typical Chinese diagnostic method.
sentences.chinese: 脈診是中醫的一種非常神奇而典型的診法。

sentences.english: Pulse-taking is so complicated that it has developed into a unique diagnostic system.
sentences.chinese: 脈診是中醫的一種非常神奇而典型的診法。

definition: to feel sb's pulse

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
(TCM) observation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
holistic diagnosis and treatment (TCM)
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
(TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
prognosis
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
medical knowledge/principles of medical science
theoretical foundation
to investigate
